q: `` He's going to have to show the ability to adapt to new competitive threats and to the changing Internet landscape,'' said Clayton Moran, financial analyst at Benchmark Co., an investment bank. First and foremost, he's going to have to show that he's a polished leader, capable of taking control of a company that has a$ 200 billion valuation. Shares of Google climbed 1.3 percent to$ 635 in after-hours trading, following the announcement. Eric Schmidt , who was named Google's CEO in 2001, will assume the role of executive chairman,

an effort to speed up decision-making at the internet giant. In a regulatory filing last week, Google said that Eric Schmidt in December drew up a plan to sell some of his stock in the company. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. As of 31 December, Eric Schmidt had about 9.2 million shares in Google- a holding worth in excess of$ 5.6 billion at today's stock price- and controlled 9.6% of the

Page praised Eric Schmidt , too.`` There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly,'' Page said. Eric Schmidt is a tremendous leader and I have learned innumerable lessons from him. The change in command overshadowed Google Inc. 's fourth-quarter earnings, which soared past analysts' estimates as the company cranked up its Internet marketing machine during the holiday shopping season.
